meanings.definition: Able to return to its original shape or size after being stretched or compressed.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was very elastic, stretching easily and then bouncing back to its original form.
meanings.sent2: The elastic waistband on my pants allowed for a comfortable fit and then snapped back into place.
meanings.sent3: The elastic slingshot flung the pebble with great force, surprising everyone around.
meanings.sent4: Her elastic mind could quickly adapt to new ideas, always bouncing back from challenges.
meanings.sent5: The elastic trampoline surface provided a fun and bouncy experience for the children.

meanings.definition: A material or fabric that stretches easily and then returns to its original shape.
meanings.sent1: She sewed an elastic into the waistband of the skirt to allow for movement and flexibility.
meanings.sent2: The swimwear was made of a special elastic that ensured a snug fit while swimming.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled an endless string of colorful handkerchiefs from his elastic sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The elastic of time seemed to stretch and contract as they waited for the train.
meanings.sent5: The elastic in the socks kept them from slipping down during the long hike.

meanings.definition: A band of rubber or similar material used to hold things together or to keep something in place.
meanings.sent1: She tied the package with an elastic to keep the papers secure during transit.
meanings.sent2: The elastic around the broccoli bunch kept the vegetables fresh in the refrigerator.
meanings.sent3: The elastic on his wrist snapped playfully as he flicked it at his friend.
meanings.sent4: The elastic of friendship held them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The elastic on the mask looped comfortably around his ears, ensuring a snug fit.
